We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Facility Manager
Job Location:&nbsp;Sagamu, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Purpose


	The Facility Manager is responsible for ensuring that all buildings, grounds, and infrastructure are safe, functional, and well-maintained.
	The role involves overseeing maintenance, repairs, utilities, and security while managing vendors, budgets, and compliance with health, safety, and environmental standards.
	The Facility Manager ensures that the work environment supports productivity, comfort, and safety for all staff, students, and visitors


Key Responsibilities
Facilities Maintenance and Operations:


	Oversee daily facility operations, including electrical, plumbing, carpentry, and mechanical systems.
	Develop and implement preventive maintenance schedules for buildings and equipment.
	Ensure timely repair of all facilities-related issues to prevent service disruptions.
	Conduct regular inspections to ensure that facilities are in good working order.


Health, Safety, and Environmental Compliance:


	Ensure compliance with health, safety, and environmental standards (HSE).
	Conduct routine safety checks and risk assessments of facilities and equipment.
	Promote and enforce safety policies and emergency procedures (e.g., fire drills, first aid readiness).
	Coordinate waste management and ensure a clean, safe environment for all users.


Vendor and Contract Management:


	Supervise external contractors and service providers for cleaning, security, pest control, maintenance, and repairs.
	Review and negotiate service contracts, ensuring quality and cost efficiency.
	Monitor contractor performance and ensure timely delivery of services.


Budgeting and Resource Management:


	Prepare and manage the facilities budget, including expenses for maintenance, utilities, and supplies.
	Track expenditure to ensure cost-effectiveness and adherence to financial plans.
	Maintain accurate records of maintenance activities, assets, and service contracts.


Infrastructure and Project Management:


	Plan and oversee facility upgrade or renovation projects from start to completion.
	Liaise with architects, engineers, and contractors for building and infrastructure improvements.
	Ensure that all facility projects are delivered on time, within scope, and within budget.


Team Leadership and Collaboration:


	Supervise facility staff (technicians, cleaners, security personnel) and assign duties effectively.
	Train and motivate team members to maintain high performance and adherence to safety standards.
	Collaborate with departments to understand their facility needs and provide timely support.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;consulting591@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Executive Assistant to the Managing Director",
  "description": "Lheon Consulting Limited is a strategy development and talent consultancy company, devoted exclusively to career shaping and personal development activities.We work globally with professionals and experts in the financial sectors to offer resourceful training, assessment and recruitment services to financial and non-bank financial institutions through use of innovative technologies to achieve a perfect workplace.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Assistant to the Managing Director
Job Location:&nbsp;Benin, Edo
Employment Type: Part-time

Job Description


	To provide comprehensive executive support to the Director, ensuring efficient management of schedules, communication, and correspondence, while also overseeing the smooth operation of the facility estate, travel/immigration processes, and secretariat. The role requires discretion, organizational skills, and multitasking to ensure both executive and administrative functions are effectively managed.

title: Recruitment Outsourcing Manager Job at PG Consulting Limited
content:
PG Consulting Limited is a recruitment, training and business consulting firm. We provide our clients - businesses and corporate organizations - across different industries with superior human capital, high-quality trainings and cutting-edge consulting to help them drive organizational growth, multiply staff productivity, gain appropriate market positioning and maximise profit.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Recruitment Outsourcing Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Industry: Consulting

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Coordinate manpower management across multiple client accounts.
	Lead recruitment, payroll processing, employee documentation, and performance tracking.
	Serve as a primary contact for clients, ensuring timely resolution of issues and SLA adherence.
	Supervise HR field staff and ensure proper deployment and compliance at client sites.
	Prepare and review HR and payroll reports, staff movement logs, and compliance registers.
	Ensure adherence to labour laws, health & safety policies, and internal operational standards.
	Contribute to business development efforts by identifying outsourcing opportunities and optimizing service delivery.


Requirements


	B.Sc. / HND in Human Resource Management, Business Administration, or related discipline.
	5 – 10 years of solid experience in HR operations or outsourcing (preferably in a consulting firm).
	Professional HR Certification is an added advantage.
	Strong people management and client servicing skills.
	Excellent knowledge of Nigerian labour law and HR best practices.
	Excellent communication, leadership, and organizational skills.


Benefits


	Competitive salary based on YOE (very attractive)
	Leadership development and career growth opportunities
	Exposure to top-tier clients across industries
	Dynamic and supportive work culture


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidate should send application to: Jobs@pgconsultinguk.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
